task.title: Generate Dataset Using SPARQL
task.shortdesc: Generate a dataset from a SPARQL Query.

taskbody.context: SPARQL is a query language used to search for and generate a dataset from a database, as opposed to using a dataset that has been pre-loaded from a turtle file.

step.cmd: Click the Commands tab to open the main control panel.
At the top of the panel, click the drop down menu labelled SPARQL.

info.i: NOTE: In this exampe, the user chose the CWRC SPARQL database. You can also search public databases that use RDF linked data like DBpedia. Or, you can upload a database from a file or URL (must be formatted as a .ttl file).

step.cmd: Enter your query in the Find box.
step.stepresult: If the search turns up matches, the text box will turn green. Matching terms will appear in a pop-up window. If the search has zero matches, the text box will remain grey.

step.cmd: Select a matching term from the pop-up window.
Choose the number of nodes to to load in your initial dataset.
step.info: NOTE: Datasets generated from a SPARQL query are updated live. Activating a node, for example by dragging it into the centre of the graph, will generate another query and retrieve additional matches from the database.

taskbody.result: The dataset has sucessfully loaded and nodes are in orbit, ready for action.
taskbody.example: In this example, the user searched the CWRC SPARQL biography database. After searching for the term "Elizabeth I," the user found a match and generated a dataset of nodes connected to this subject.
